cells.data:
If you wanted to check an embed that wasn't the default, the app will error out in the console. You could check to see if the player ID ends in "_" + something else and skip appending '_default' in that case.

It's a player management API feature that isn't exposed in the studio. Basically, it lets customers build a bunch of different players that all share some common configuration. If you don't use the feature (which most people don't), your player ID ends in "_default"

The original request from PM (three generations removed) was unlimited inheritance for player configurations.  We truncated that at one level as that covered most of the cases we expected and was much simpler to implement.  But it unfortunately hasn't yet made it to the UI.
